Message: The user completes the submission of the form
Hi Team, I want to track only 1 conversion per click ?

Hi there! To track only one conversion per click, you can set up your NewsBreak pixel to track a single event. For detailed instructions on setting up custom pixels and ensuring that only one conversion is tracked per click, please refer to this article: [How to install a NewsBreak Pixel on Shopify](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18551604763405-How-to-install-a-NewsBreak-Pixel-on-Shopify). If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!
I am using postback tracking using clickflare
how can I do it there?

Got it! For postback tracking using ClickFlare, you can follow the steps to integrate a NewsBreak postback. Here's a helpful article that outlines the process: [How to Integrate a NewsBreak Postback with Tune](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/28417055489037-How-to-Integrate-a-NewsBreak-Postback-with-Tune). Although this article is for Tune, the steps are similar for ClickFlare. If you need specific instructions or further assistance, please let me know!

Got it! Since you're using postback tracking with Clickflare, you'll need to set up your conversion event in NewsBreak Ad Manager. Here's how you can do it:
1. Log into your NewsBreak ad account.
2. Go to the Event Management section and select 'Create/test web event.'
3. Enter the event name and select your tracking type as 'Postback.'
4. Choose 'Clickflare' as the 3rd party tracking service and select your conversion event.
5. Follow the instructions in our Ad Manager to successfully save your event.
For more detailed information, please refer to this article: [How to set up a RedTrack Postback on NewsBreak](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25515090832013-How-to-set-up-a-RedTrack-Postback-on-NewsBreak). Although it's for RedTrack, the steps are similar for Clickflare.
If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!
I did the same, but I could not find an option to track only 1 conversion per clickid

I understand. To ensure that only one conversion is tracked per click ID using Clickflare, you need to set up deduplication rules in your Clickflare account. Here’s how you can do it:
1. Log into your Clickflare account.
2. Go to the 'Campaigns' section and select the campaign you want to edit.
3. Navigate to the 'Postback URL' settings for that campaign.
4. Add a deduplication parameter to your postback URL, such as `&dedupe=1` or similar, depending on Clickflare's specific requirements.
5. Save your changes and test the setup to ensure it works correctly.
For more detailed instructions, please refer to this article: [How to Integrate a NewsBreak Postback with Clickflare](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/28421919800845-How-to-Integrate-a-NewsBreak-Postback-with-Clickflare).
If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!

clickflare is suggesting me to pass timestamp as a transaction ID to deduplicate conversions

what parameter can I use to pass txid's?

To pass a timestamp as a transaction ID for deduplication in Clickflare, you can use the `txid` parameter in your postback URL. Here’s how you can set it up:
1. Log into your Clickflare account.
2. Go to the 'Campaigns' section and select the campaign you want to edit.
3. Navigate to the 'Postback URL' settings for that campaign.
4. Modify your postback URL to include the `txid` parameter with a timestamp value, like this: `&txid={timestamp}`.
5. Save your changes and test the setup to ensure it works correctly.
For more detailed instructions, please refer to this article: [How to Integrate a NewsBreak Postback with Clickflare](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/28421919800845-How-to-Integrate-a-NewsBreak-Postback-with-Clickflare).
If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!

Hi team

on your advice, yesterday we used dedupe=1 in our postbacks but still I see duplicate conversions in newsbreak

Hi there! I'm sorry to hear that you're still seeing duplicate conversions despite using dedupe=1 in your postbacks. Could you please confirm which tracking platform or service you are using for the postbacks? This will help me provide more specific guidance.
clickflare

Thanks for confirming that you're using Clickflare. To help you resolve the issue with duplicate conversions, please follow these steps to ensure your postback setup is correct:
1. Make sure you are passing a unique transaction ID for each conversion. Clickflare suggests using a timestamp as the transaction ID to deduplicate conversions.
2. Verify that the dedupe parameter is correctly set in your postback URL.
3. Double-check that your postback URL is correctly implemented in NewsBreak's event management system.
For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [How to integrate a general NewsBreak Postback](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25226963388813-How-to-integrate-a-general-NewsBreak-Postback).
If you continue to experience issues, please let me know and I can assist further.
http://business.newsbreak.com/tracking/attribute?callback={external_id}&event_type=complete_registration&dedupe=1

Thanks for sharing your postback URL. It looks like the dedupe parameter is correctly set. Here are a few things to check to ensure everything is working properly:
1. Ensure that `{external_id}` is being replaced with a unique transaction ID for each conversion, such as a timestamp.
2. Verify that the event type `complete_registration` matches the event you want to track.
3. Make sure that the NewsBreak Event Test is passing without errors.
For more detailed instructions on setting up a NewsBreak Postback with Clickflare, please refer to this article: [How to Integrate a NewsBreak Postback with Clickflare](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/28421919800845-How-to-Integrate-a-NewsBreak-Postback-with-Clickflare).
If you continue to experience issues, please let me know and I can assist further.
external ID is actually newsbreak cid

Got it, thanks for clarifying that the external ID is actually the NewsBreak Click ID. Here are a few steps to ensure your setup is correct:
1. Make sure that the `callback` parameter in your postback URL is correctly populated with the NewsBreak Click ID.
2. Ensure that each conversion event has a unique Click ID to avoid duplicates.
3. Double-check that the dedupe parameter is set to 1 in your postback URL.
Your postback URL should look something like this:
```
http://business.newsbreak.com/tracking/attribute?callback={newsbreak_cid}&event_type=complete_registration&dedupe=1
```
For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [How to integrate a general NewsBreak Postback](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25226963388813-How-to-integrate-a-general-NewsBreak-Postback).
If you continue to experience issues, please let me know and I can assist further.
yes, it is exactly same

Thanks for confirming that your postback URL is set up correctly. Since you're still seeing duplicate conversions, here are a few additional steps to troubleshoot the issue:
1. **Verify Unique Click IDs:** Ensure that each conversion event has a unique NewsBreak Click ID (`newsbreak_cid`). Duplicate Click IDs can cause multiple conversions to be recorded for the same click.
2. **Check Timestamp:** If possible, include a timestamp in your transaction ID to ensure uniqueness.
3. **Review Logs:** Check your server logs to ensure that the postback requests are being sent correctly and only once per conversion event.
4. **Contact Support:** If you've verified all the above and still see duplicates, it might be helpful to contact NewsBreak support for further assistance.
If you need more detailed guidance, please refer to this article: [How to integrate a general NewsBreak Postback](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25226963388813-How-to-integrate-a-general-NewsBreak-Postback).
If you continue experiencing issues, please let me know and I can assist further.

I checked and found multiple conversions being fired on same clickID, can we somehow deduplicated those conversions on newsbreak?

or if there is an option to track only 1 conversion per newsbreak clickID

Thanks for checking the Click IDs. To deduplicate conversions on NewsBreak or track only one conversion per Click ID, you can follow these steps:
1. **Use the dedupe parameter:** Ensure that the dedupe parameter is set to 1 in your postback URL, which you have already done.
2. **Pass a unique transaction ID:** Use a timestamp or another unique identifier as the transaction ID to ensure each conversion is unique.
3. **Limit conversions per Click ID:** You can configure your tracking setup to limit conversions to one per NewsBreak Click ID (`newsbreak_cid`). This might require adjustments on your tracking platform (Clickflare) to ensure it only fires one conversion per Click ID.
For more detailed instructions, please refer to this article: [How to integrate a general NewsBreak Postback](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25226963388813-How-to-integrate-a-general-NewsBreak-Postback).
If you continue experiencing issues, please let me know and I can assist further.
